event.text: Without warning, a large hole opens up around you, dropping you a number of feet down into the earth. You land on your feet within the sinkhole but see no easy means of escape.

outcome.text: You attempt to climb out of the sinkhole using the roots and rocks jutting out from the pit's walls. Twice, you get tantalisingly close to the top before losing your footing and falling back down. On the third attempt, you manage to successfully make it out and move en route to home.

Time and time again, your best efforts to escape the pit are thwarted by the loose stones and roots the line the cavities walls. Sometime later, you emerge from the sinkhole. The exhaustion brought on by the ordeal elipses the minor cuts and bruises it caused.

You wait inside the sinkhole for a passerby to help you out. Minutes pass. Hours pass. Almost an entire day of rest passes before a wandering pilgrim walks, happy to fish you out of the pit. You thank them repeatedly before bidding each other farewell and going your separate ways.

Miraculously, after what must only be 15 minutes, a rope is thrown down over the edge of the sinkhole. You grip it, tugging firmly before throwing your entire weight on to it. You climb out with ease, ready to praise whoever helped you out but there's nobody to be seen...
